scene_metadata.title: The Personal Project Prison
scene_metadata.psychological_theme: internal battles manifesting as external struggles
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: the jail we build from our own conflicts

dialogue.visualization: imagining himself writing a manuscript inside a jail
dialogue.text: He wanted to talk about why I struggle with my personal projects. He tried to free me from my own jail â€” in which I spend time and energy on things that bring no external rewards or even validation.

visual_elements.imagination_overlay: Evan in jail cell with manuscript
visual_elements.jail_details: bars made of self-doubt, walls of expectations
visual_elements.evan_in_cell: hunched over writing, imprisoned by his own creation
visual_elements.lighting: harsh fluorescent inside, warm light outside bars

psychological_notes: The voice identifies personal projects as prisons when they become obligations rather than expressions. The lack of external validation becomes its own trap, turning creation into punishment.
philosophical_underpinning: We imprison ourselves with the very things meant to free us
therapeutic_direction: Recognizing how internal conflicts manifest as creative blocks
